keyword: how many calories in ramen noodles
title: How Many Calories in Ramen Noodles?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in ramen noodles per standard package, including carbs, protein, fat, sodium, and preparation tweaks for better nutrition.
h1: How Many Calories in Ramen Noodles?
assumptions: Instant ramen noodles, 1 standard package (85g dry weight), chicken flavor, prepared in boiling water without added oil, eggs, or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, flavor, package size, and preparation method. Check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: One package of instant ramen noodles contains about 380 calories, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Skip the flavor packet for lower sodium
Add one boiled egg as topping
Use half the oil packet if included

faqs.q: How many calories in a package of ramen noodles?
faqs.a: Approximately 380 calories for a standard 85g dry package.

faqs.q: Are ramen noodles high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, one package has about 1580 mg sodium, over 60% of daily recommended intake.

faqs.q: How many carbs in ramen noodles?
faqs.a: Around 52 g carbs per package, primarily refined noodles.

faqs.q: Calories in cooked vs dry ramen noodles?
faqs.a: Calories are based on dry weight; cooking adds water but doesn't change calorie count significantly.

faqs.q: Can I reduce calories in ramen noodles?
faqs.a: Yes, by skipping the flavor packet, using less oil, or adding veggies for bulk without extra calories.
